revised_title: Influence of Temperature and Strain Rate on Fatigue Strength in Metals
tldr: The authors conducted fatigue tests on mild steel at various temperatures and cyclic speeds to study the effect of speed on fatigue strength. They discovered that the fatigue strength of mild steel is significantly higher at 10 c/min than at 2000 c/min in the temperature range of 200-300°C. This behavior is attributed to strain-ageing. The study also highlights the influence of frequency on the fatigue strength of metals at different temperatures.
